stages.logText: In Undertell, I found an ominous stone etched with strange symbols. As I touched I touched its glowing mark, an unnatural chill ran through me, and I heard a voice in my mind, calling out for help. It spoke of torment and told me to return to Crossglen to find answers.
The presence of the mark grows unbearable. I feel an overwhelming pull to return to Crossglen. There is something wrong, and I sense it’s tied to my father. I must hurry to see what’s happening.
I spoke to father. He assured me he’s fine, but mentioned Leta hasn’t been herself lately. She’s been pacing her home and muttering to herself. I should check on her and see what’s going on

When I confronted Leta, she seemed different—angrier, more agitated. As I pressed her, a dark spirit suddenly manifested before me and attacked. I defeated it, but it didn’t feel like the end. I need to return to Undertell and find out what this spirit truly is.
The dark spirit that had been trapped inside Leta has fled back to Undertell, where its power seems to grow stronger. I need to return there and finish what I started.
In the depths of Undertell, I found the dark spirit waiting for me. It was stronger this time, but I defeated it once and for all. Whatever bond it had with me—and Leta—is broken.

I returned to Crossglen to find everything changed. Leta has aged decades in an instant. Her child is now fully grown, and her timid husband, Oromir, seems like a different man entirely. They remember nothing of what happened. The spirit may be gone, but its curse has left a permanent mark on the lives it touched.
